SENT.plain: Lemierre's syndrome, also known as postanginal sepsis, is a rare condition that presents as an increasing sore throat due to acute pharyngitis or tonsillitis and progresses to sepsis, due to suppurative thrombophlebitis of the internal jugular vein
We present an atypical case of Lemierre's syndrome complicated by carotid thrombosis
The etiological factors and the diagnostic and therapeutic measures are discussed
